page.title: 08LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Before}Ladybank had a{piped water supply the inhabitants were{dependent {on natural springs. Every house}had its{own well. }At one time there were} {13 artesian wells.}There are still{11, {8 of which run constantly.}Our {Telephone Exchange was}once called {Palace Place.}This was a block of houses with{1 room always for a {vagrant.}Close to the railway was a{cattle market.}There were{over 30 {shops in Ladybank,}now there are only {13. The last working horse in Ladybank {died in 1947.}He was called {"CHARLIE"and pulled the wood cart.}A } modern block of flats was once a{hotel with{stabling for horses.}The{main {employers}were the{linen factory, malt {barns, railway and lemonade factory. There were{two small schools}before ours. They taught{Maths and English. They charged{1/2d. per day.
